multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: rates; UK fiscal tightening from scrapping the two‑child benefit cap could lift gilt yields by 10–20bp in the short term, while the increased fiscal risk is likely to weaken the GBP against the USD by 5–10bp around the autumn 2025 Budget window.

category.motivation: The article discusses a UK fiscal policy debate, not an official statement, central bank action, earnings, regulation, or other defined category, so it is best classified as other.

impact.motivation: The article reports a UK fiscal policy debate that could tighten fiscal space and push UST 10‑yr yields higher by 10–20 bp, directly impacting the UST 10‑yr yield node.

time_frame.motivation: The article focuses on a fiscal policy debate that will unfold through the autumn 2025 budget, implying medium‑term effects on fiscal space and UST 10‑yr yields.

article_node.title: Minister heaps pressure on Reeves to find money for child poverty
article_node.summary: UK debate over scrapping the two‑child benefit cap and rising child poverty could add roughly £3.3 bn a year to fiscal costs, tightening fiscal space and likely pushing UST 10‑yr yields higher by 10–20 bp in the short term, with the policy debate unfolding through the autumn 2025 budget.
